(44) 252.Uth May, 1944.WAR CABINET.THE ITALIAN AIR FORCE,Note by the Secretary of the War Cabinet.THE Prime Minister has directed that the annexed minute, addressed to himby the Secretary of State for Air, should, be circulated for the information ofthe War Cabinet.(Signed) E. E. BRIDGES,Secretary.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,Uth May, 1944.ANNEX.Air Ministry,Whitehall S.W. 1.Prime Minister,A report has been received from Air Vice-Marshal Foster on handing overcommand of the Italian Air Force on the 27th March, 1944.2. During the six months of his command the following results were obtained : Enemy aircraft destroyed in the air or on the ground 19; damaged 10,Enemy ships claimed as destroyed 11; damaged 74.Weight of stores dropped in Yugoslavia 163 tons.Number of persons saved in Air /Sea Rescue 18.Against this the Italians lost 10 aircraft in action, 9 in accidents and5 "lost or destroyed," and 29 aircrew personnel killed, wounded or missing.3. During the six months 3,309 sorties were flown. At the end of march the force numbered : Serviceable aircraft in operational units ... ... ... ... 218Aircraft available for transport, communications and schoolduties ............... ...... ... 129Aircraft being rebuilt after salvage ... ... ... ... 734. Air Vice-Marshal Foster concludes by saying : " The actual flying units have shown unexpected good qualities. I havebeen frankly surprised at the operational standard, produced. I consider thatas far as their own Air Force is concerned, the Italians have met in full theobligation which they undertook at the time of the Armistice. The Italian AirForce has during the past six months made a whole-hearted effort to contributeits share in operations against the enemy, and I feel that this fact should beplainly recorded so it can be placed to the credit of the Italians when the timefor settlement comes."5. I am sending a copy of this minute to the Foreign-Secretary.(Initialled) A. H. M. S.9th May, 1944.[27453]
